intro: Thysanotus triandrus var. hispidulus, commonly known as the hairy starflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive blooms and compact growth habit.
